    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    class 
    CoinTray
    Simulates the tray where dispensed coins go for the user to collect them.
    class 
    UnidirectionalChannel<T>
    Represents a simple device (like, say, a tube) that allows things to move in one direction between other devices.

  • Uses of Sink in com.unitedbankingservices.banknote

    Classes in com.unitedbankingservices.banknote that implement Sink
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    final class 
    BanknoteDispensationSlot
    Represents a banknote slot device that can dispense one or more banknotes, leaving them dangling until the customer removes it, via BanknoteDispensationSlot.removeDanglingBanknotes().
    final class 
    BanknoteInsertionSlot
    Represents a simple banknote slot device that can either accept a banknote or eject the most recently inserted banknote, leaving it dangling until the customer removes it, via BanknoteInsertionSlot.removeDanglingBanknote().
    class 
    BanknoteStorageUnit
    Represents devices that store banknotes.
    final class 
    BanknoteValidator
    Represents a device for optically and/or magnetically validating banknotes.

    Field
    Description
    Sink<Coin>
    CoinValidator.overflowSink
    Represents the output sink of this device when a valid coin cannot be stored its standard sink.

    Represents the output sink of this device when a coin is rejected.

    Fields in com.unitedbankingservices.coin with type parameters of type Sink
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    final Map<Long,Sink<Coin>>
    CoinValidator.standardSinks
    Represents the set of output sinks to which to route valid coins, indexed by the supported denomination of the coins.
